Reviews.Title: “More a transit hotel, woth only for being quite close to Warner park.”
Reviews.Author: Crina L
Reviews.Content: The bad are ok: you have a good sleep. The hotel is in a commercial area (many clothing stores around), but also industry. However if you are interested in Warner park is a suitable location: 10 minutes by car to the park Otherwise, quite poor services: - the rooms smelled very bad, even the non-smoking ones: probably because the window opens only 10 cm. The air was not fresh at all. - we had to insist very much to obtain a non-smoking room, even if we were not asked and on the reservation site we did not have the option to choose between smoking and non-smoking. - poor breakfast - no fridge or safe box in the room - the TV did not work - they should offer some fast entry for the Warner park

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: KLMAN333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night whilst travelling through Spain. Hotel is well situated only a few minutes drive from the M50 motorway/ Albecete motorway access, and provides free parking for guests. The hotel rooms are clean, well furnished and ideal for a overnight stay. The hotel itself is situated on a development which contains a shopping centre, McDonalds and several warehouse/business premises. The shopping centre is only 5 minutes walk from the hotel and provides numerous retail outlets and a large supermarket. Likewise, McDonalds is just 2 minutes walk away. The hotel itself is in quiet location despite the nearby businesses and shopping centre. There is evidence of some minor traffic noise from the nearby Madrid to Albacete motorway but this was not excessive from inside the hotel room we occupied, on the front of the building. A nice touch by the hotel is the production of a compimentary printed daily newspaper summary in English. Compimentary breakfast was very good, considering the price paid for the double room.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel by truck drivers.”
Reviews.Author: recep i
Reviews.Content: We had a long journey by car. The hotel's location is very bad. Traveled a great deal in the industry, to find the hotel. Me happy to find an empty parking lot. Receptionist greeted us bad. room was clean. Breakfast not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Silvending
Reviews.Content: Me and my family decided to travel to Parque Warner.. Soon we realised that there weren't too many hotels were we can choose by... Therefore, we have chosen this one.. In my opinion, the hotel is nice.. guests have an ice machine, so we can prepare drinks in our rooms, no fridge or safe in the room. Rooms have nice accomodation and everything was cleaned every day... sheets, pilows, etc.. Breakfast is nice and simple.. there aren't too much were we can choose from, The main issue i found during the breakfast, was the existence of the machines in one single side, so, there was a long line to use them.. (waste of time)... The hotel is located in a quiet place, were we can find restaurantes nearby, even a mcdonals and a mall. Tbe Parque Warner, is located about 15 kms.. too easy to reach.. Afterall we can say that, for the price payed... i think we found a nice, quiet and accomodate place..

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Menidi
Reviews.Content: If anyone is travelling on business, I urge you to avoid this hotel with all costs! no room service, no restaurants inside the hotel, no decent breakfast, no complementary water in the room.. and the no's dont stop I found hotels with the same about price range with much better quality closer to madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Tricky fees!”
Reviews.Author: Mercado-family
Reviews.Content: We picked hotels online that listed accommodations for parking, WiFi internet connection, breakfast. This hotel charges 3 Euros for 30 min access to internet. Can only use 1 computer in cafeteria. Very frustrating. Charge for basic TV channels. Hotel is near industrial area. Rude staff. Looks clean. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: anthonyhenhawk
Reviews.Content: First off there is no shuttle service from the airport so your paying at least 20+ Euro there and back each way. It's located in the middle of nowhere, very industrial area. The staff was okay, not %100 welcoming. There is a bus stop located 10mins away but if you want to get downtown you have to cross a busy highway over a bridge which is another 15mins from the first bus stop. If you have a car it might be alright. Without a car this place is a complete nightmare. Never would I stay here again... EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, great staff, safe...exactly what you expect in HI Express”
Reviews.Author: VonWandurer
Reviews.Content: I originally read poor reviews for this hotel and stayed at Novotel Naciones in Madrid. That hotel reeked of smoke and the rooms were dingy. Ended up staying here and was pleasantly surprised. The place is very clean--the cleaning staff works until 2000 every day. The rooms are modern, you don't have to pay for tv, there's free breakfast, the staff is amazingly helpful, and there's a nice bar. For dinner, there are no nearby restaurants save a steakhouse. The steakhouse is good, not great. The portions are small and the prices hefty. If you need to eat, order from the Chinese take-out place; wholly moley, it was surprisingly good. For transportation, you can walk to the bus stop and take a bus to Avenue of the Americas and then catch the metro from there to see all of Madrid. A taxi to the airport varies since the cab drivers seem to have a button they push that suddenly adds additional costs onto any ride. We went to the airport several times and noticed the best fares were subjectively applied when we talked nicely to the driver. We were stuck in Marid after the volcano and enjoyed our time at HI Express; if you really want to be closer to the cultural sites, this is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid!!”
Reviews.Author: CocoLoco69
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Madrid, we stayed 2 days. The hotel is way out from city center. Holiday Inn had free parking for our car, which was its only plus. It is run down, really showing the wear and tear. The room was very small - only one person could walk around the room at a time. There was only room for one piece of our luggage to be accessible at a time. The only view is from the breakfast area on the main floor, the desk staff were not overly helpful in telling us what amenities were in the area, laguage barrier. There is a small mall a couple blocks away, but in driving around on our own found a major mall about 2 km away that had restaurants open late. The driving directions to get to the hotel were confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for Rivas area”
Reviews.Author: Destiny185
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Rivas Vaciamadrid in August of 2008. This hotel is good on location, nearly to Rivas Centro which is there the mini mall situated in that area. This hotel was chosen mainly because we were visiting our family who live in the area. The hotel is not recommended for those who are wanting to stay in the “real” Madrid, you would need to stay in either Puerta Del Sol, which is the city’s main area, full of shops, & entertainment places. They include a free continental breakfast that consists of bread & rolls, 3 types of cereal, juices, coffee, milk, hot chocolate, cakes/donuts, tinned fruit. Room are comfy and a good enough size. Sheets changed every 2 day or whenever you want. Be warned, staff do not speak English that well. Only the front desk staff speak slight English, people around the area don’t speak English as well, so make sure you know your phrases. Overall good hotel if you need to be in Rivas.

Reviews.Title: “Next to 8 lane highway under flight path with nothing in walking distance”
Reviews.Author: FussyJustABit
Reviews.Content: If you stay here you must have a car. We got a taxi. There are no shops or amenities you can walk to. You are basically stuck next to a building site and wast areas. Beer cost 11Euro a pint Breakfast is complimentary, what that means is it is cheap and nasty. If you like dry bread, rubber ham and cheese you will luv it. No pool, bar is smaller than my kitchen. Courtesy bus from the airport is not courtesy it is 7 Euro per person. Stay some where else, near the shopping mall near the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Good location, get what you expect”
Reviews.Author: JeremyEdwards
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and end of our touring holiday of Spain (we flew to Madrid and hired a car). The hotel is 2 mins off the main motorway between Madrid and Valencia. About 15 mins from the airport. The hotel is exactly what you expect from a HI Express, clean, functional but not luxuirious. Breakfast was good, the rooms were quiet and the staff friendly and english speaking. Nearby was a McDonalds and a shopping centre (2 mins drive, 10 mins walk - which included about 5 different chains of restuarant and a supermarket, together with free parking underneath). Would stay again providing I could get it for under 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for people with cars”
Reviews.Author: b98006
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March, 2005. Got very good rates and excellent service. Rooms were very clean and staff very helpful. It is 15 minutes drive from Madrid and the directions can be confusing the first time. Do not expect to walk to the metro station from here - its quite far. If you have a car, and you dont mind staying out of the city, this is a GREAT budget hotel. Food is good also, very nice breakfast is included in the rate, parking is free and it is very peaceul - nice to get away from the loudness of the city to sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Madrid-Rivas
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida De La Tecnica 8, 28529 Madrid, Spain
